title: Relational Hour
abstract:
MarkLogic for Oracle DBAs 
Hsiao Su, MarkLogic
 
If you're new to MarkLogic but you're familiar with the terms Oracle DBAs use, come to this talk and hear some common MarkLogic terms and concepts described in RDBMS parlance.
 
ODBC for MarkLogic 
Mary Holstege, MarkLogic
 
If you could talk to the animals, what would you talk about? If you could talk to MarkLogic (with its XML data model) in SQL (which operates over a relational data model), what would that look like? Come hear Dr Mary Holstege describe what she’s working on for a future release of MarkLogic – a way to talk to MarkLogic in SQL over ODBC.
 
Using a Relational Databases with MarkLogic 
David Lee, MarkLogic
 
xmlsh provides a simple and efficient way to integrate relational databases to MarkLogic. Using just a few scripting commands, relational data can be extracted from Oracle, Mysql, sqlite etc. and easily preprocessed into XML documents and loaded into a MarkLogic database. Just as easily, MarkLogic can be queried and the results stored into a relational database. Since the processing is all run within a single process, using streaming and multithreading the process is highly efficient and suitable for production enterpise environments, as well as being simple and easy to develop.

surveys.comments: Mary's talk on SQL was great. Found talk on xmlsh less useful
